roleset.name: leak, let forth water sparingly, letting water through accidentally or because of damage, let forth
roleset.note: LEAK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'leak' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry 43.4, other framed members include exude. Comparison with exude. (from leak.01-v predicate notes)
LEAK-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to leak.01-v. VN class say-37.7 and substance_emission-43.4. Framed by Katie. (from leak.01-n)

example.name: intransitived
example.text: At stake was an $80,000 settlement involving who should pay what share of cleanup costs at the site of a former gas station, where underground fuel tanks had leaked and contaminated the soil.

example.name: transitive
example.text: He-1 is also accused of lying under oath and of *trace*-1 leaking information obtained from a wiretap he supervised.
example.arg: information obtained from a wiretap he supervised

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: The roof's leaking water all winter lead to a massive mold infestation above the garage come spring.

example.name: gol for leaked to
example.text: the leaks to The New York Times

example.name: non-information leak with gol for end point
